newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close up, supported by Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close up, supported by Wall Street.

text.p: French shares closed higher on Wednesday, supported by strength on Wall Street, and traders were moderately hopeful about further progress.
"If New York finishes higher, if the dollar holds steady in around 5.25 francs and rates stay steady, we have the grounds to move a bit higher," said one.
Erasing Tuesday's losses, the blue-chip CAC-40 index finished up 25.19 points or 1.15 percent at 2,218.89 while the CAC-40 futures settled at 2,221.0 against 2,195 on Tuesday.

Insurer Axa climbed 1.54 percent to 309.50 francs after the expiry of its share exchange offer for rival UAP. The companies announced a new executive lineup for the merged group bearing Axa's stamp with 10 of the 16 members of the executive committee from Axa.

Shares in luxury goods group LVMH soared 8.37 percent to 1,375 francs after a U.S. arbitrator cleared its bid to buy U.S. duty free chain DFS. LVMH forecast the deal would boost operating profits by some 30 percent.
Bank Credit National climbed 7.5 percent on a press report speculating it could be bid target, saying its share price was undervalued. But analysts were uncertain about who might bid.
